reviews.review_msg: polymer chemistry was a very hard class, I found the lectures to be heavy but somewhat very fun. Steven is very caring and understanding, his exams were really long and very conceptual but if you study the notes, you will be fine. He is an amazing professor and explain the concepts extremely well. I feel lucky for having a class with him.

I was always so scared to ask him any questions during lecture or office hours. I did it once, and he gave me a condescending remark and look as well. I tried to stay away from him. He only does experiments in class, and the lecture slides are general guides. He says to students who failed before "Welcome back". Kind of sarcastic, hazing culture.

Steven is a great prof and is amazing to have as a lecturer. The only problem with this course (Polymeric Materials Chemistry) was that we were marked only on two midterms and a final which were incredibly difficult to do. Most of the class suffered, but our grades were curved drastically. I was going into the final almost failing and got a B- lol.

A good teacher who knows how to explain concepts. Lectures contain many example questions to illustrate concepts. Lectures also contain some live demonstrations which are always fascinating. The lab is long and sometimes tiresome but does make sense and ties in with the rest of the material. Exams and marking are straightforward and fair.

Prof Holdcrofts lectures are nice because he explains things very clearly and orderly, and on top of it all his English accent makes it all sound like a peaceful therapy session and not a hard General Chem course. Midterm is agreeably hard, but some of the hardest question I know has a similar style to the txtbook questions, so pay attention.

His midterm is the reason so many people are going to have to retake this class, it was ridiculously difficult (good luck future students) and had an average of 50% (which he said was normal?????) FIRST OFF that should NOT be a normal average if you want your students to succeed. Only good thing about him was his in-class experiments

Stevens a nice guy but he really screwed us all over with the midterm, it was INSANELY difficult; he said it was going to be similar to the practice but it was absolutely nothing like it and around 300/650 students failed it (average was 50%); the questions were NOTHING like the textbook/homework/practice test or anything we had covered in class

Holdcroft is a good professor with an nice accent and the topics covered in the course are complex so I'll give him credit for explaining things well. My biggest issue was how hard the midterm was. The practice exam was said to be the same level of difficulty but that was HUGE a lie. If the class average is 50%, the students aren't the problem.

A great prof for first year chemistry, light hearted, funny, and incredibly nice. There is quite a bit of homework for the course but that is constant whether Holdcroft or Warren is teaching the course. His explanations are clear, he is passionate about chemistry and focused on making sure his students succeed.

The prof is one of the best that i have had so far, he is good at explaining and makes chem fun (never thought i would say that). the material gets harder by the week and there is a LON CAPA due every Saturday and there is a lab which is mandatory which also has another LON CAPA that is need to be completed before each lab.

It's been a little while since I took 1st year chem with him. But now that I reflect back he really sets you up for success. News flash, grades don't come easy. You have to work HARD if you want that A. 1st test gave me a taste of reality and I learned to pull it together after. Really helped my future study habits. Do your practice problems kids

Passionate, knowledgeable and clear. That being said it is a very difficult course you really have to work and utilize everything, especially the practice questions and his office hours time. For a content-heavy class he explains it well
Funny guy especially with the British accent. Lots of material in class so it's hard to stay focused. Went to his office hours and he was super helpful, explained everything perfectly.

Great prof, hard class! Keeps you entertained with experiments and then goes over examples and does a practice midterm to help. Really knows his stuff. You have to put in the effort to do well. Review, attend lecture, do the examples and you will succeed. Given the course difficulty he's great at explaining that much material. Prepare to work hard!
He's cool
Would never take it with him. Funny guy but you learn nothing. Avoid at all costs!! Take Chem 121 with Mund instead! Now that guy knows how to teach!

Funny guy with a nice accent. He goes through examples extremely quickly and sometimes you cant read his writing. Read the textbook before lecture. Also attend tutorials because some TAs can explain a lot clearer. Midterm was fairly difficult; had to know the formulae because there is no formula sheet. Demos were entertaining.

Good prof; clearly explained all concepts, midterm was very fair (similar to examples he went over in class & the practice midterm he posted).  Experiments during class were entertaining (although they didn't really contribute much to learning), and his notes were very straightforward and clear.

His exams were tough but fair. His lectures were engaging and thought-provoking; he not only goes over useful practice questions, but also shows their application in the real world. I would not recommend his classes as GPA-boosters; however given the amount of material covered, he explained the concepts very well.

So many ppl failed the midterm. It was killer. Unfortunately b/c the large group of ppl who are way smarter than B avg students bring the avg up and create a very positively skewed distribution which masks a big part of the class (the "normal" students). Tips: Read textbook and do the end of chapter q's (pretty much same as lec slides),do lon capa.

He has a lot of demos in his lectures which are fun. He gives good explanations of each concept but to succeed in his exams, you need to make sure you go to tutorials and do lots of practice questions.

His lectures can be quite confusing, and he seems more interested in finishing the lectures over conveying the actual important concepts. Be ready to learn lots of them on your own if you want to do well, and expect that the midterm will be at least twice as hard as the in class problems.

attend tutorials and do as many questions from practice exam and textbook as you can. forget the lecture if you want, he talks about other stuff and does useless experiments anyway, 33 MCQ midterm in 2 hours

Midterm was hard but if you studied practice exams and online work, you'll do fine. His experiments relate to concepts learned in class and are exciting to watch but won't help you for exams. Makes you come to class since online notes are fill-in-the-blanks. Goes fast at times since a lot of content to learn and memorize but he's easy to follow.

If you do ALL of the textbook questions, you will get an A. People complain that he does all these cool experiments and does not prepare you well for the midterm... But the questions that he goes over are very similar to the midterm and his notes are super concise and to the point.

Midterm is 34 multiple choices in 2 hours, but RIDICULOUS hard questions. 400 people registered, average is only 56%.30% of the class failed! People say is fun, but seriously who cares? i do not need a person that jokes all time and ruins my GPA. Be mature guys, wondering how can this guy gets 3.7 for overall rating....
Hilarious prof, but he CANNOT teach. Class is fun with a lot of cool experiments but you don't learn anything, and then that midterm comes..... dont take the class with him. trust me.

Holdcroft is one of the funniest profs I've had. He is very thorough when he does examples, although sometimes he goes a bit fast. A lot of the course is repeating chem 11 stuff. He does a lot of fun experiments and gives good hints for exams.

makes you memorize lots of formula. does too many experiments at the expense of explanations of concepts and examples, midterm seemed mostly fair. Didn't try to reexplain when i asked him a specific question from the lecture, just told me to go home and think about it. Do lots of practice questions from both textbook and "his" practice midterm

good prof with concise notes. almost every lecture he does an interesting experiment. he's engaging in class and you can really tell that he loves what he does. however, the midterm was a tad bit tricky

His lectures were fun and informative. The homework given with the class is hard and long, which also includes a lab and homework for the lab too. Midterm was super hard. Otherwise seems like a really cool guy, really enjoyed listening to him and he made chemistry interesting to learn about. Also super HOT and has a British accent. Enjoy it!

1. Pointless of attending lecture, 50% of the class rather prefer to study themselves/ Doing useless experiment in lecture, NOTHING to do with exams.  2. Make things extremely complicated, do it for chem and mbb students, we are here to learn BISC, not CHEM, little relations be honest. 3. Heavy British accent, makes you dizzy in lecture HARD EXAM
Tried to be fun in class, achieved that. Tried to teach in class, didn't happen. Fun experiments/explosions but poor actual teaching skills.

really nice guy and tries to help but you realize when you're trying to study for his midterm that he did so many (fun) experiments that he didn't actually teach you anything so it was really difficult

Really liked the lectures that he gave, super engaging despite me hating chemistry.  His notes are super clear and easy to see what is important. Lon-capa was really difficult, but not impossible to figure out. However his midterm was awful, nothing like the rest of the course and didn't test on much we learned.  Great prof, awful exam.

Great lecturer, with concise notes relative to the stuff on the exams. LON Capa is super hard, but really sets you up to do well on exams, which is weighted higher anyways.  Awesome Lectures, especially with boring chemistry.

Genuinely nice, engaging guy. Often did a fun demo in class and is a good lecturer. The LON CAPA is difficult, but it prepares you for the midterm. Fairly difficult midterm. The lecture slides are available on Canvas, but they have fill in the blanks you need to be in lecture to write down.
Engaging lectures and interesting demos, doesn't go through problems in lecture, which is fine with me. Very nice if you come to his office hours. Midterm was pretty challenging.

Holdcroft usually has a funny, entertaining demonstration lined up for his lectures. He's a jokester and can make the class laugh. He speaks slowly with many pauses so I never felt rushed to copy down notes. Even though he was less wordy than most profs, Holdcroft explains concepts clearly and tells you exactly about the equations/material on exams
Good instructor.  Fair marker.  Lon Capa is a bit annoying, but manageable.  Only bad thing was he made us memorize a bunch of useless formulas.  Kind of old fashioned that way.

Great Professor, his lectures are very in depth and he's passionate about his subject. He performs interesting experiments usually in his lectures which help keep the class engaging. His Lon Capa's are TOUGH which i guess is good for mid term preparation.
Soooo much loncapa homework.. and the questions are all so hard. I feel like the loncapa was almost harder than the exams..
realyyyyyy funny prof

Holdcroft is amazing. His accent is beautiful and he really is funny. He explains very well and his notes are helpful. He dresses well and reminds me of somebody that should be in a James Bond movie. I recommend his class.
Was a mediocre professor but rarely provided examples in class and rushed certain sections. I'd recommend reading the textbook and really putting extra effort!

I really didm't understand anything he said in class. His midterm wasn't easy at all. He just did useless experiments in the class that made you laugh, but once you actually go home and think about it, you see that it was just pointless and you learned nothing in class!

Steven tries to make the class interesting with his demos and has a great accent and always there to help. Must attend lectures for fill in the blank notes. Make sure to do lon capa, it's hard but sets you up for exam. Exams are hard but easier than Capa. He doesn't do many examples which is a downside.

LOVE his accent, and his demonstrations in class kept people more or less focused on his lectures. He does not do many examples in class however, so definitely study and look at textbook examples for an easier time on the midterm.

He was a really nice prof, very enthusiastic about chem and performing experiments. Could have been better if he provided more examples in the notes. Don't expect to not study lots, this course is a lot of work and requires you to self learn. Be prepared, the midterm was difficult but fair. Be sure to know all material before the exam.

He does teach the tougher part of course first off. Too many experiments not enough examples, his midterm was beyond fair. The CAPA was wa tougher and at least 7/33 questions were on practice midterm or questions posted online so if you did bad thats kind of on you....
Loves to do fun experiments but they didn't teach you anything. Doesn't do any examples in class, which makes understanding the concepts extremely hard. Overall, hard course. His midterms was hard
Made class fun, great accent, but I didn't always have the easiest time with assignments... Still nothing horrible, especially for first year
A interesting guy with English accent. He knows how to teach and performs lots of experiment. Easy midterm, not sure his final because he left during second term.
Great prof, very engaging with his demonstrations in lectures. Available for help during office hours, which he keeps. Responsive to emails. Homework and tests are more difficult than average.
His lectures were surely fun and interesting, but his assignments and exams were absurdly hard..
this guy has a great accent, his lectures are clear and informative, and he explodes something every single lecture overall great prof

Though teaching the harder half of CHEM 121, he with his amazing experiments and strong sense of humor successfully academically excited almost every students. One could tell that everyone was concentrated. Despite on slightly intensive lectures, with the help of his example questions I managed to get 31/33 in midterm. My best professor this term.

His class is very interesting, he does a lot of fun experiments in class. However, he does not explain everything really clear, I get pretty bad on the first midterm. Also, he does not give a lot of examples, no help with the lecture.

He was good looking for sure. Haha. He wasn't too clear in his lectures, but would always want you to go and ask him questions. I found the review that he gave for the midterm to be extremely helpful.

He may not be the best in teacher, but i the questions and mid term examples he reviewed in class and the process he showed in picking answers was really helpful. he is also entertaining and blows things up and has a nice humor. attending classes was pretty fun, but this is chemistry so... as far as chem 121 goes, holdcroft rules!!
Very charismatic and easy going. British rugby-player type. Explodes a lot of things in class, keeps jokes rolling and teaches very well. Sad that he was only teaching for half the course.
Enjoyed him as a prof.  Very nice guy.  Offered me encouragement when I struggled with the first midterm.

definitely enjoys his job but he's not that great of a prof. he makes things explode in class which is cool. but he's not very good at explaining things and is very confusing with the harder information. his midterm is not that easy.only had him for the first half of the semester so i don't know about his final

Enthusiastic, can be dry, has plenty of interesting demonstrations, fair marker. Though attendance not mandatory, helpful for homework and midterm as he goes over questions, so strongly encouraged. Midterm was fair, study hard. He only taught half of the course, so don't know what his finals are like.

Very interesting and charismatic prof whose voice alone will hold your attention. Class is riddled with fun/relevant experiments. He does not really prepare you that well for the midterm, (class avg ~55%) so it's up to you to read the textbook and work on your own. Highly recommend doing many practice problems before midterm. Overall, definitely an

Awesome lecturer, doesn't go too fast or too slow.  Demos (maybe avoid front rows) relate to concepts taught, and he rounds out the textbook with real-life contexts every day.  Very encouraging and helpful, but, yes, this is university and you do need to read the text and, as he says, develop your own problem solving skills.
Most entertaining prof ever. Did some very cool demos. And he made the course interesting...just wished he was teaching the entire course...and has the best accent/voice ever
entertaining but not teaching,more like a circus

Really great professor.  He must have taken some of the constructive criticism because he has gone through many problems in class this semester.  Concepts are made clear in class, and he is always very open to answering any questions.  Makes class interesting with lots of cool chemistry experiments. My favorite prof so far in 3 years of university.

He is a very nice prof. Very open to answer your questions. His classes were the most fun class i had that term. Study hard for his mid-term, his questions seem very easy but usually there is always a twist to it.
Loved the experiments in class so much that I didn't realize I wasn't really learning the material. Make sure you can teach yourself!

Taught with Leach. This guy loves to do hands on chem, and when it comes to exams he goes through questions if you want him to. Thing is, I ended up pretty much teaching myself this whole course. As a prof he's decent because he gets you on your toes in a sense but make sure you can really help yourself through the material.
KEeps class interesting with fun experiments but rarely teaches problems. You MUST be able to teach yourself the material. The midterm was very hard.

Very interesting prof but insanely hard midterm. Does at least one demo per class mostly blowing up stuff. But does not do that many examples in class. If you are taking chem for fun its a good class but if its required try to get another one. Prof G.Leach is better.

An easy prof to listen to; his accent and experiments kept the lecture entertaining. However, after completing the midterm and receiving the lowest score of my life I must say that unless you are able to efficiently teach yourself the material thoroughly, good luck. IF YOU HAVE PASSED ONE OF HIS TESTS THAN YOU HAVE SURVIVED HELL!

A very good professor. Clear, engaging and interesting. Answers questions in class, provides lecture slide before the class starts to facilitate note-taking. Did a good job imparting a large amount of information. He clearly identified the things we would need to know for the midterm, then tested us on those things.

Holcroft was a really interesting prof to have, with a fun accent. He did a lot of experiments in class too which was pretty cool but outside of that I feel like I didn't learn much. Attendance mandatory to fill in the blanks he leaves on his online notes.

Compared to Leach, Holdcroft isn't too great. Holdcroft focused on theories and main ideas so when the midterm came, it was difficult because we spent more time on theories rather than practicing equations. Leach, on the other hand, goes through several thorough examples during class.
Love all his experiments but I wish he would do more difficult examples during class.

Holdcroft is a cool dude but I'm not a huge fan of his teaching style. Sure he does wicked explosions but after the midterm I realized that I'd truly rather have him do example questions related to the material. Considering that BEWARE-brutal midterm is designed so practically no one finishes . Attend all lectures and review the material right afte
Awesome prof. hard class. He kept lectures interesting by blowing stuff up. Beware of midterm for it is challenging.
He is the best chem prof ever. His experiments are awesome although I'm not too sure if the midterm will be good though. I worship this man

Great prof. Always kept the class interesting. He had a huge amount of material to cover, but he always let us know which equations/material we needed to focus on in order to do well on the exam. Midterm was difficult, but if you stay on top of the curve you'll do very well in the course. Be sure to do all assigned reading. It really does help!
Like his being a funny british geek style...but be honest ,I learnt almost nothing from him .Perhaps it is because this is a easy course just require grade 12 chem ...NICE PRO THOUGH...

At first, I thought he was a pretty cool exciting prof until the midterms and finals came, I realized I didnt really learn the stuff he taught in class except for the demos he showed which I kind of looked forward to. Overall, not a helpful prof.
midterm is super hard. Lecture is fun but notes are useless. Great guy though.
He is by far the best chem teacher at this facility. He makes university appealing, hes absolutely hillarious, keeps you on your toes, and his experiments are fantastic.
His classes are fun in that he has quite a few experiments, some consisting of lighting balloons flled with oxygen or methane, or using liquid nitrogen. It's one of my more interesting classes.

This guy loves to blow stuff up and do other cool demonstrations in class. Funny and interesting lectures. There is a lot of material to cover in this course so nothing is really covered in depth in lecture. Exams are MC but tough.
helps create fun intro chem class but lectures not informative and the exams were difficult

I thought this guys was really funny, but a horrible professor. You would ask him a questions and he would be like "look it up. I don't have time to discuss these basic topics with you. I have more important matters to deal with right now. Can you go bother someone else?" I thought he thought himself above the scope of the course.
LMAO make us laugh some more holdcroft!!!!
hehee, pyromaniac!
Nice guy, but I felt that he put more energy into blowing stuff up instead of teaching. Lectures weren't all that in depth.
Excellent prof! Great experiments in class to keep us entertained. Knows his stuff really well and able to communicate it to the class. Very helpful outside the class. Tests=fair.
(1st half); MC exams affect studying methods; looks (& sounds) like Gordon Ramsey
Good prof. Super nice guy, would definitely take another class with him.
Best prof youll ever have, very helpful, nice and also makes lectures a treat
love this guy, so funny!
he is cool. that is all.
Best prof i've had so far. Very nice. Keeps lectures interesting by doing experiments. I also appreciated his understanding of the first year experience.
i think he is a very good prof, the lectures were fun and exciting, i actually looked forward to them
He seemed like a good guy. Good demos. Lectures were a bit boring though.

Lectures are very easy, experiments are very exciting (don't sit in the front row!) Gets a little excited and lets off the fire extinguisher by accident. Midterm was VERY hard! Unfortunately only teachers first half of course.

Nice guy, did do a lot of experiments and made class interesting.  Deffinately didn't walk you through every little thing, and only did brief power point presentations so you do have to do work on your own time.

Charismatic guy... lectures are very entertaining because of the experiments and explosions, but he doesn't cover the material in depth, PPTs are basically a skim through the textbook. I had to rely on the fact that I took the AP equivalent in high school to get a decent mark on the midterm.
I LOVE HIS COOL EXPERIMENTS.. BUT THE CLASSES COULD BE MORE CLEARER.

Worst prof in the world!  Just explodes stuff in class. That's why students like him, because he doesn't teach anything. Sure, you can get a good mark in his class but be prepared to pay for the lack of knowledge later in life.

Good speaker.  Demos and sense of humour keep the class interesting.  Always announces office hours in class.  Homework and midterm were fair.  If you want to do well read the textbook and do extra practice questions.  Notes provided are adequate.    I would take a class with him again.
best person in the world!!!! great guy!!!

If you took chem courses in high school, you will do well in this course. Otherwise, the course isn't really easy. His notes are subpar...I loved his crazy experiment demonstrations during lecture, though.
best prof ever!! half of the class time is always spent on experiments!!  great explosions that attracted security and the fire department!!  mind-term/final  is not to bad for those who are smart!!

omg the class is a blast! so awesome--but omg his notes are so awful:S they arent worth 2 cents! and his midterm was crazy ass hard!! he didnt explain things very well and the book wasnt great help either! but hes a god guy

Holdcroft spent most of his time in class focusing on his experiments.  So if you love to watch a tennis ball fly across the lecture hall then this is a class for you.  His notes are a mess!  Nothing comes from the text book, and he does NOT explain things well at all. Midterms are hell on earth!

Awesome Prof. Loves to blow the class with his experiments. At times u feel as if u r in a theatre enjoying the show. But exams are hard. Have to have luck on your side to do really well as u'll have to answer a lot of multiples through guesses coz there will be no time to answer.

Holdcroft was wild prof, but man his midterms were impossible. Clyburn was not as exciting, but at least he taught us something and was around in his office if you had questions and his tests were easier.  Holdcroft is not around.

This guy love to do experiment in class.  They are very interesting and a lot of fun.  His midterm is impossible, but you will certainly have fun in his class if you don't mind being smoked from his test.
Holdcroft is a coool prof!! You will never fall asleep or get bored in his class. And am i the only one that thought his midterm wasnt that bad? I thought Clyburnes was worse!

very hard midterm, but a very intriguing class overall! especially after CLYBURNE came into place...that course was fun until that point, when everything turned out to be DISASTROUS...after you have clyburne you'll realize that Holdcroft's class is HEAVEN
He is the COMPLETE OPPOSITE of Jason Clyburne. Need I say more?
Very hard to sleep through his class . . . he's always blowing things up.  It's actually quite entertaining, and his jokes aren't bad either.
Nice guy, funny aswell, and sort of crazy with the blowing stuff up thing, but that's good. :) The midterm was horrible though!!
lecture were fun, lots of experiments, midterm was too much theory though, he's an easy going guy but midterm wasn't fair

Loves to blow stuff up.. He will actually shoot a tennis ball into the middle of the class just for the fun of it. Tries to make a really difficult course like Chem 121 interesting and fun. You'll enjoy this course if you take it with him, but you gotta put in a lot of work to actually understand it

A super British soccer fans - MAN-U !! I always wonder that if he would make the test more difficult when Man-U loses.....haha...anyways.......super interesting experiements in EACH LEC.  .......u won't fall asleeep fore sure......tests are based on theories more than calculations....WATCH OUT !
course was so easy he had to make stupid nit-picky questions for the exam
very fun prof with awesomely cool demos! hard midterms, but the class is curved so that should be okay...questions are very hard, but they are "intelligent" questions.
I thought that his midterms and final were much too difficult for the portion that he taught. He asked questions that were much more challenging than any practice ones that he gave us.
Sweetest teacher on earth!
His demos are the best!!!  It makes students interested in his class.  He's a very nice, easy-going person.  However, his midterm wasn't nice or easy at all.  Class average was 50%!!
awesome proff, wicked demos

Duuuuuuuuuuude if he wasn't the BEST teacher ever he'll still kick everybody's ass...made chemistry SOO MUCH FUN of course haven't seen a test yet but just from the demos he does in lectures you can tell he's very enthusiatic about chem...GREAT PROF
he is hilarious, interesting lectures..awesome demos
No Comments
He is very funny in the class...talks about Britain Soccer and explodes balloons....well, but he really need to work on his English speaking skills.
This guy lectures well, interesting demos, but doesn't know how to write an exam, way to challenging for a first year course

His notes contain everything, but the textbook will treat you just as well. He is a very interesting guy, soccer fanatic (especially Manchester United), works at Ballard as well. Nice English accent.Chem121 is a boring course but he makes it not half bad.
Hard prof, very tough exams, goes extremely fast thru every chapter, not through at all
I think he is a good prof. He tried his hardest to keep you interested in the class eventhough chem 121 is the most boaring! If you read the text before class he actually is a very good teacher.

It's too bad he couldn't teach Chem 121 for the whole semester.  Out of the 3 profs that taught that course, he was by far the most interesting one.  Demos were timed strategically to wake up all the sleeping students. :)
He made the course interesting. Although the textbook is the best source of information.
his notes don't help and his accent isn't ANY BETTER
Powerpoint notes posted on web; aren't very useful. English accent, talks about soccer and ballard fuel cells whenever he can. Funny, generally interesting.
Notes were okay . . . nice experiments & Man U rocks!
horrible notes --> basically it's the textbook, lectures are even worsethanno
useless notes, boring lectures, cool explosions, nice accent
did not explain anything.  other chem prof was much better
HARDDD final exam! but a great prof
Good Demos and talks about soccer and fuel cells
Course is good.  M/c exams are good.  Demos make up for boredom.
m/c midterms all about  exceptions  in rules. memorise 'em all!
almost the whole class sleep during lecture
pretty good teacher, but not spectacular. Great demos to keep your attention
Good prof but kills you on final/midterms.  explosions are spectacular!
Great prof, Great teaching
Snooze during the first 45 minutes, catch the last 5 with the explosions.
one of the good profs
lectures unclear.  no open-ended questions on midterm.
Hard exam but a good teacher
really really boring lectures.
i thought the midterm exam was okay, it's very very simlar to the sample midterm
the only thing i liked was the explosions
Very funny. Enjoyed the class but exams were hard.
No Comments
his lectures were entertaining, and his accent was sexy!
No Comments
Entertaining lectures but difficult exams.
Very entertaining but exams were m/c but hard.  No partial mrks for calculations
He's entertaining - I liked the experiments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
funny lectures, not that boring, but hard exams
